item.title: Defensive Programming Rule #4: Safe and Efficient Type Casting
item.description: This article emphasizes defensive programming by highlighting safe type compatibility checks in .NET. It advises using the 'is' keyword to prevent InvalidCastException and warns against unnecessary type casts that clutter code and affect performance. The open-source project Spargine aids developers with tools for better validation and logging, promoting cleaner, more resilient applications. Link to article: https://dotnettips.wordpress.com/2025/11/16/defensive-programming-rule-4-safe-and-efficient-type-casting/

item.title: Defensive Programming Rule #3: Validate Your Enums (Every Time)
item.description: Enums enhance code readability but can lead to errors if not validated, as any integer can be cast as an Enum, including invalid values. Validating Enum inputs prevents silent data corruption, ensures meaningful defaults, and avoids processing impossible states. Always validate at method boundaries and define a zero value as "unknown." Link to article: https://dotnettips.wordpress.com/2025/11/09/defensive-programming-rule-3-validate-your-enums-every-time/
